intro: Macrolobium colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are palmately lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
